WorkItem.Description:

************** JIT Debugging **************
To enable just-in-time (JIT) debugging, the .config file for this
application or computer (machine.config) must have the
jitDebugging value set in the system.windows.forms section.
The application must also be compiled with debugging
enabled.
 
For example:
 
<configuration>
    <system.windows.forms jitDebugging="true" />
</configuration>
 
When JIT debugging is enabled, any unhandled exception
will be sent to the JIT debugger registered on the computer
rather than be handled by this dialog box.
 
 
Hope this is helpful in some fashion.  I have yet to configure JIT debugging as I don't want to 'mask' the issue until I'm sure it isn't important.

Comments.Message: Looks like you've somehow got either two copies of Rawr running, or most likely you're running Rawr from a location that you don't have full permissions to.

This is a home PC and I'm the only user.  I have admin privileges on my log in.  I'm wondering whether double clicking on the file at program startup may be causing the program to load twice?  Wouldn't I get a notification of this someplace or do I need to monitor Task Manager?  I suppose I could log in under Admin but that would be a strange bug if that were the case.

I've gotten these notifications only when changing my talents after downloading my character from the armory. I'm often asked to heal/moonkin so this is a convenient method for  me.
As an aside (suggestion).  Would it be possible to somehow allow the talent trees to be cleared with a single stroke rather than clearing them 1 talent at a time?

I'm not exactly sure what caused this user's process error, but while changing talents for my resto druid, I noticed that the log file was growing at an exceptional rate. 

Clearing the log and changing one talent wrote almost 2000 lines to the log.  

Offending line: Line 198, Spellrotation.cs Tree project.
